greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n-th column sum of binary digits of k*2^(k-1), where summation is over k>=1, without carrying between columns.
comment: Row sums of triangular arrays in A103588 and in A103589. - _Philippe Deléham_, Apr 04 2005
example: Binary expansions of k*2^(k-1), with bits in ascending order by powers of 2, are:
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{lg = Floor[Log[2, n]] + 1}, Sum[ Join[ Reverse[ IntegerDigits[n - i + 1, 2]], {0}][[i]], {i, lg}]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 105}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 26 2005 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 30 2003
